intro: Rhazya thracica, commonly known as the Thracian rhazya, is a perennial herb native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, oval berries. Rhazya thracica is adapted to rocky and dry habitats, showcasing its resilience in challenging environments.
